instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG? PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG is a power rail that powers the GPU in an S0 working state. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Hi
Board is not turning power on when i measure <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> shows 1.5V. Removed F7040-F7041 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.5V ok. After injected  3.5v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line GPU is warming up. Then I removed <RESISTOR>R8998</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R8999</RESISTOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8961</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8962</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8963</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8964</CAPACITOR> GPU is not warming so GPU is dead ? And now also machine can not power on is it normal ( not fan spin and another thing about working) ?
if GPU is not get power machine cant turn on?

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR>-<TRANSISTOR>Q8931</TRANSISTOR>, if <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> is shorted (highly possible), you have injected 3.5V directly to GPU, so, maybe, GPU is fried..

If you want to try, replace both mosfets and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> and pray for it to work..... :)

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Thanks for help aprendiz but I didnt inject <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> voltage, injected <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line  3.5V . And when i removed <RESISTOR>R8999</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R8998</RESISTOR> short to ground stay another side (at <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> line) so if <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> and 8931 was shorted groun when i removed this resistors it have to stay short to ground is it correct or i know some things wrong?

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Agree with you, but if <TRANSISTOR>Q8930</TRANSISTOR> was not shorted or stuck (active or closed), there is no way that GPU gets hot if you inject voltage on PPBUS G3H...

What is the resistance to GND on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL>??

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: when i out red probe diode mode 0,30 ohm shows.

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Remember CPUs and GPUs have a very low resistance so you will get a very low voltage drop in diode mode!
Don't think it is a short to ground! Best way here is to compare values with a working board

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
In diode mode is not resistance, it is voltage drop.........

[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 2368"]What is the [COLOR=#FF0000]resistance[/COLOR] to GND on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL>??[/QUOTE]

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: When i check resistance to ground 32ohm shows this board but i have another same board ( not sure about healty) 27ohm shows. ( Also removed <RESISTOR>R8998</RESISTOR>,<RESISTOR>R8999</RESISTOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8961</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8962</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8963</CAPACITOR>,<CAPACITOR>C8964</CAPACITOR>) [U]red probe at gnd.[/U]

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Well, there is no short here, just low resistance and thats ok....... As i told you before, replace <TRANSISTOR>Q8030</TRANSISTOR>-<TRANSISTOR>Q8031</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP>. I hope that GPU is not fried........

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Thanks Aprendiz when i replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8030</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q8031</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> same time machine start to fan spin not mounted computer body and didnt connect any cable. After mount computer and connected lcd cable and other cables it stoped again :( same problem at start. 0,25 A use at powersupplay connect and nvidia litte hot, not fan spin and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> line is 1.5v . is this problem cause by damaged LCD? or nvidia try to turn on when lcd connected its damage <TRANSISTOR>Q8030</TRANSISTOR>,8031?

Note: when i change only <TRANSISTOR>Q8030</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q8031</TRANSISTOR> at same time not working when i change <TRANSISTOR>Q8030</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q8031</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> same time,fan spins but connected LCD totaly dead and same parts damaged:(

any body have idea?

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Replace all parts again and test by thunderbolt before connect the display, see if you have video, also check display connector and cable...........

threads.title: 820-332-a <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Thank you aprendiz. i ll try it when i find parts,3 times damaged parts all donor board is used:)
